eventsFunctionsExtensions.author: @Lizard-13
eventsFunctionsExtensions.fullName: Snap objects to a virtual grid
eventsFunctionsExtensions.name: SnapToGrid
eventsFunctionsExtensions.shortDescription: Action to snap objects to a virtual grid during the game.
description: An action which, when applied on some objects, snap these objects to a *virtual grid*, with cells having customizable width and height.
Useful for level editors or putting objects on a tiled based map (RPG, strategy games, or any tiled based game in general).

eventsFunctions.description: Snap object to a virtual grid (i.e: this is not the grid used in the editor)
eventsFunctions.fullName: Snap objects to a virtual grid
eventsFunctions.name: SnapObjectToVirtualGrid
eventsFunctions.sentence: Snap _PARAM1_ to a virtual grid using cells with  width: _PARAM2_px, height _PARAM3_px and an offset position (_PARAM4_; _PARAM5_)

events.comment: Round the Object position to snap to the in-game grid

parameters.description: Objects to snap to the virtual grid
parameters.name: Object

parameters.description: Width of a cell of the virtual grid (in pixels)
parameters.name: CellWidth

parameters.description: Height of a cell of the virtual grid (in pixels)
parameters.name: CellHeight

parameters.description: Offset on the X axis of the virtual grid (in pixels)
parameters.name: OffsetX

parameters.description: Offset on the Y axis of the virtual grid (in pixels)
parameters.name: OffsetY

eventsFunctionsExtensions.author: @4ian, Entropy, VegeTato
eventsFunctionsExtensions.name: Flash
eventsFunctionsExtensions.shortDescription: Make an object flash visibility (blink), color tint, object effect, or opacity (fade).
description: Make an object flash for a period of time so that it alternates between two different states.
Includes the ability to flash visibility (blink), color tint, object effect, or opacity (fade).
After adding a behavior to an object, you **trigger the effect** by using the **Flash action**.
- Let players know they are invincible after being hit
- Catch player attention on the interface (for instance a "press start" text)

eventsFunctionsExtensions.name: TiledUnitsBar
eventsFunctionsExtensions.shortDescription: A bar that represents a resource in the game (health, mana, ammo, etc).
description: A bar that represents a resource in the game (health, mana, ammo, etc).
There are ready-to-use resource bars in the asset-store [resource bars pack](https://editor.gdevelop.io/?initial-dialog=asset-store&asset-pack=resource-bars-resource-bars).

eventsBasedObjects.description: A bar that represents a resource in the game (health, mana, ammo, etc).
eventsBasedObjects.name: TiledUnitsBar

events.comment: This allows to detect a change of "intial value" on hot reload.
Pass the configuration to the behavior (MaxValue must be set before Value).

Children instances must be resized when the button size change:
- background is resized to take the full dimensions of the button
- the bar size is refreshed according to the value

The scale is set back to 1 because it means that the parent instance has the same dimensions as the union of its children instances.

eventsFunctions.description: Center the bar according to the button configuration. This is used in doStepPostEvents when the button is resized.
eventsFunctions.name: CenterBar

eventsFunctions.description: the value of the object.
eventsFunctions.name: Value

events.comment: The value is clamped by the behavior. This is why Object.Value() is used instead of Value directly.

eventsFunctions.description: the maximum value of the object.
eventsFunctions.name: MaxValue

eventsFunctions.description: Check if the bar is empty.
eventsFunctions.name: IsEmpty

eventsFunctions.description: Check if the bar is full.
eventsFunctions.name: IsFull

propertyDescriptors.description: It's used to detect a change at hot reload.
